      • getAsyncRequests

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,com.r3.corda.networkmanage.common.signer.crl.CRLData> getAsyncRequests()

        For CRL signing we use a LinkedHashMap to make sure that the insertion order is preserved to avoid an old CRL becoming valid in Identity Manager (it always uses the latest persisted CRL)

      • createSignedCRL

        public java.security.cert.X509CRL createSignedCRL(java.util.Set<com.r3.enm.model.CertificateRevocationRequest> newCRRs,
                                                  java.util.Set<com.r3.enm.model.CertificateRevocationRequest> existingCRRs,
                                                  java.lang.String crlIssuer,
                                                  NonExistentClass userInfo)

        Builds, signs and persists a new certificate revocation list. It happens only if there are new entries to be added to the current list.

        Parameters:
        newCRRs - list of approved certificate revocation requests. An approved certificate revocation request is a request that has status RequestStatus.APPROVED - i.e. it has not yet been included in any CRL.
        existingCRRs - list of revoked certificate revocation requests. A revoked certificate revocation request is a request that has status RequestStatus.DONE - i.e. it has already been included in another CRL.
        crlIssuer - who issues this CRL.
        Returns:
        A new signed CRL containing both revoked and approved certificate revocation requests.
